trans-unit.source: Represents an exception that occurred when there is something wrong with the security applied on a message.
An example where this exception happens is if signature verification fails.
This exception usually happens during application message exchange (when security context is fully established).
In addition, it can occur while establishing a security session on top of the initial security context.
Initializes an empty instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessageSecurityException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessageSecurityException"></xref> class with an error string.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessageSecurityException"></xref> class from the specified instances of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> classes.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance that contains the information required to serialize the new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessageSecurityException"></xref> instance.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains the source of the serialized stream associated with the new <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessageSecurityException"></xref> instance.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Security.MessageSecurityException"></xref> class with an error string and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
